Utilities

Class AppTester

  • java.lang.Object
    • Utilities.AppTester

  • public class AppTester
extends java.lang.Object
    Use this for various testing/debugging purposes including multi-threaded print statements with built in stack trace, assertions that stop the entire application rather than just the current thread, and application termination with a full stack trace for terminal error conditions. Can also check and respond to background events.

    • Nested Class Summary

      Nested Classes 
      Modifier and Type Class and Description
      static class  AppTester.DefaultPrintStream
      Used to specify which standard output terminal bound strings should be sent through.
      static class  AppTester.Rank
      Used to rank terminal readouts based on relative importance.
      static class  AppTester.ReadoutCondition
      Used to specify whether something is being printed under an error situation or a non-error situation.

      static AppTester.DefaultPrintStream EITHER_STD_OUT_OR_STD_ERROR
      Used to specify that some terminal output should go through standard out and some terminal output, such as exception stack traces and assertion failure, should go through standard error.

      Used for readouts that are important, such as error messages.

      The system independent line separator, shortened to two letters for convenience.

      The default Rank for terminal readouts.

      Used to specify that all terminal output should go through standard error.
      static AppTester.DefaultPrintStream ONLY_STANDARD_OUT
      Used to specify that all terminal output should go through standard out.
      static AppTester.Rank UNIMPORTANT
      Used for readouts that are unimportant, such as explanations of code flow.

      • setMyDebugLevel

        public static void setMyDebugLevel(AppTester.Rank level)
        Parameters:
        level - all messages that are at this debug level or higher are printed. Messages that are below (less important than) this debug level are not printed.

        Parameters:

      • getLogFileNameOrEmptyString

        public static java.lang.String getLogFileNameOrEmptyString()
        Returns:
        Either the name of the log file or empty string if the log file was not successfully created.

      • close

        public static void close()
        Closes the AppTester by killing any background threads it may be running and closing its log file writer. Must be called at or before termination.

      • printlnToReadout

        public static void printlnToReadout(java.lang.String message,
                                    AppTester.ReadoutCondition condition,
                                    AppTester.Rank severity)

      • printToReadout

        public static void printToReadout(java.lang.String message,
                                  AppTester.ReadoutCondition condition,
                                  AppTester.Rank severity)
        This print statement is meant for use by other print statements in this class, but it can also be used as a more verbose alternative to print(java.lang.String) or printerr(java.lang.String) if you desire not to include file names or line numbers.. It also appends text to the log file, but unlike printEx and print, this method does NOT include the line number, method name, or class name at the top of the print statement.
        Parameters:
        message - the message to be printed
        condition - whether the message is an error or non-error message

      • killApplication

        public static void killApplication(java.lang.String message)
        Kills the entire application and leaves a stack trace.
        Parameters:
        message - - message to print before the application terminates.

      • killApplication

        public static void killApplication(java.lang.String message,
                                   java.lang.Throwable t)
        Kills the application, prints a message, and also print the throwable who is responsible for the crash. Prints the entire throwable.
        Parameters:
        message - message to print before the application terminates.
        t - throwable whose stack trace is to be included in the termination.

      • killApplication

        public static void killApplication(java.lang.Throwable t,
                                   java.lang.String messsage)
        Alternate form of killApplication(java.lang.String, java.lang.Throwable). Prints the entire stack trace.

      • killApplication

        public static void killApplication(java.lang.Throwable t)
        Kills the entire application and prints out the stack trace elements of the throwable responsible
        Parameters:
        t - the throwable responsible.

      • killApplicationNoStackTrace

        public static void killApplicationNoStackTrace(java.lang.String message)
        Kills the entire application without leaving a stack trace.
        Parameters:
        message - - message to print before the application terminates.

      • check

        public static void check(boolean assertion)
        Checks to see if an assertion is true. Prints stack trace and crashes the program if not true. USE THIS INSTEAD OF REGULAR "assert" STATEMENTS. For information on how to use an assert statement, see: Programming With Assertions
        Parameters:
        assertion - - assertion to be checked

      • check

        public static void check(boolean assertion,
                         java.lang.String message)
        Checks to see if an assertion is true and prints an error message if false. Also prints a stack trace and crashes the program if false. For information on how to use an assert statement, see: Programming With Assertions
        Parameters:
        assertion - - assertion to be checked
        message - - error message to print

      • uPrint

        public static void uPrint(java.lang.String message)
        Prints an unimportant non-error message. Short for "unimportant print".

      • print

        public static void print(java.lang.String message)
        Same as print(java.lang.String, Utilities.AppTester.Rank), but with the NORMAL severity level specified by default.
        Parameters:
        message - the message to be printed as if it were a regular non-error message.

      • iPrint

        public static void iPrint(java.lang.String message)
        Prints an important non-error message. Short for "important print."

      • uPrinterr

        public static void uPrinterr(java.lang.String message)
        Short for print error not important. Prints an unimportant error. Short for "unimportant print error".

      • printerr

        public static void printerr(java.lang.String message)
        Same as printerr(java.lang.String, Utilities.AppTester.Rank), but with the NORMAL severity level specified by default.
        Parameters:
        message - the message to be printed as if it were an error.

      • iPrinterr

        public static void iPrinterr(java.lang.String message)
        Short for print error important. Prints an important error. Short for "important print error".

      • printEx

        public static void printEx(java.lang.Throwable t)
        Prints out a throwable as if it were and error and logs it appropriately. Short for "print exception".
        Parameters:
        t - Exception or error to be printed as an error.

      • printEx

        public static void printEx(java.lang.String message,
                           java.lang.Throwable t)
        Prints out a message and a stack trace caused by a throwable as an error. Message cannot be an empty string or null.
        Parameters:
        message - message to be printed
        t - throwable that caused the message to be printed

      • printEx

        public static void printEx(java.lang.Throwable t,
                           java.lang.String message)
        Same as printEx(java.lang.String, java.lang.Throwable), but with a leading message.

      • tryPollForBackgroundEventAfterEveryXms

        public static boolean tryPollForBackgroundEventAfterEveryXms(BackgroundEvent_Interface event,
                                                             long milliseconds)
        Same as tryPollForBackgroundEventAfterEveryXmsStartingInYms(Utilities.BackgroundEvent_Interface, long, long) , but the first poll occurs after a time delay equal to the delay between subsequent polls.
        Returns:
        true on successful polling event submission, false if event cannot be polled for.

      • tryPollForBackgroundEventAfterEveryXmsStartingInYms

        public static boolean tryPollForBackgroundEventAfterEveryXmsStartingInYms(BackgroundEvent_Interface event,
                                                                          long millisecondInterval,
                                                                          long millisecondsToPollingStart)
        Polls for and responds to a background event at regular intervals
        Parameters:
        event - the event to poll for and respond to
        millisecondInterval - the number of milliseconds between the end of one poll/response and the start of the next.
        millisecondsToPollingStart - the number of milliseconds until the first poll for background event occurs.
        Returns:
        true if the event can be polled for and false if an exception occurs preventing the polling events from happening.
